page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS DONAGHADEE
page.content:
Donaghadee is probably no better and no worse than any other community as regards its concern for the socially deprived or needy.
In the town are some establishments purpose built for the aged and/or infirm.There are three private nursing homes for the elderly, a Health Board Home and sheltered accommodation.
There are two holiday homes for children from disadvantaged backgrounds and a Children's Home.
As in many areas there are problems such as underage drinking and vandalism. The Community Association and others are making strenuous efforts to improve the situation in a positive way.
